title: Medieval Philosophy
description: Explore the great thinkers who bridged ancient wisdom and the modern world

questions.question: Thomas Aquinas attempted to reconcile the philosophy of which ancient thinker with Christian theology?
What are the 'Five Ways' of Thomas Aquinas?
options: Five arguments for the existence of God

questions.question: Augustine of Hippo wrote which influential autobiographical work?
The 'problem of universals' was a major debate in medieval philosophy. What did it concern?
options: Whether abstract concepts exist independently of specific things

questions.question: Averroes (Ibn Rushd) was a medieval philosopher from which cultural tradition?
Maimonides, author of 'Guide for the Perplexed,' was a philosopher of which faith?
What was 'scholasticism' in medieval philosophy?
options: A method of critical thought combining faith and reason

questions.question: Anselm of Canterbury formulated which famous argument for God's existence?
William of Ockham is best known for which principle?
Boethius wrote 'The Consolation of Philosophy' while in what situation?
Avicenna (Ibn Sina) was a medieval philosopher who also made major contributions to what field?
Peter Abelard was a medieval philosopher famous for what controversy?
options: His love affair with Heloise and his work on universals

questions.question: What was Augustine's concept of 'original sin'?
options: That all humans inherit a sinful nature from Adam and Eve
That sin was invented by philosophers

questions.question: Duns Scotus was a medieval philosopher known for emphasizing the importance of what?
Al-Ghazali's 'The Incoherence of the Philosophers' argued against the primacy of what?
options: Greek philosophical reasoning over Islamic theology
